"We believe FB will make it through this difficult period," Kessler wrote, referring to heightened scrutiny over data-privacy issues in the wake of the Cambridge Analytica scandal.
CFRA analyst Scott Kessler raised his rating on Facebook shares to strong buy from buy, though he cut his 12-month price target to $210 from $250.
Facebook shares were down as much as 2.9% in Wednesday's session, though they're now up 1.6%.
The stock is up 23% over the past 12 months, while the S&P 500 SPX, -2.33% is up 16%.
